WPP + Adobe Partner on AI Marketing, "Claude AI Killed My Business" Goes Viral, MarTech Market Projected at $3.28T

Today's top stories in AI + Product Marketing

1

WPP and Adobe Expand AI Partnership to Transform Marketing Ops

The advertising giant and software leader are joining forces on AI-driven marketing solutions to help brands operate faster at greater scale. WPP brings creative reach; Adobe brings the automation stack. Together, they're betting that AI-powered campaign orchestration is the future of enterprise marketing ‚Äî and they want to own the plumbing.

Read on CX Today ‚Üí
2

"Claude AI Killed My Business" ‚Äî Founder's Warning Goes Viral

A startup founder is sounding the alarm: her marketing SaaS was made obsolete by Claude's expanding capabilities. She predicts outreach automation and GTM infrastructure are "dead soon" ‚Äî AI agents will independently run campaigns that used to need entire tool stacks. Her controversial take: within months, marketers may just tell Claude to "launch a million-dollar ad campaign" and watch it execute.

Read on Republic World ‚Üí
3

MarTech Market Worth $3.28 Trillion by 2035

New market research projects AI, agile marketing, and privacy-first personalization will drive the MarTech industry to staggering scale. The report also highlights Braze's $325M acquisition of AI firm OfferFit last year ‚Äî a signal that lifecycle marketing automation is where the smart money is going.

Read on GlobeNewswire ‚Üí
4

IBM's GenAI Book of Business Hits $12.5 Billion

IBM reported that its generative AI signings reached $12.5 billion this quarter ‚Äî a clear sign that enterprises are moving from pilots to production. Companies with deep Fortune 500 relationships are capturing the lion's share of initial AI implementation budgets. Microsoft and Oracle are riding similar tailwinds.

Read on Financial Content ‚Üí
5

The Enterprise AI Reckoning: Why Billions Still Can't Deliver

Reality check time. Despite billions poured into LLMs, prompt engineering teams, and AI prototypes, the gap between dazzling demos and reliable production systems remains "stubbornly wide." The piece argues the current GenAI approach may be fundamentally broken for business use ‚Äî and the fix requires prioritizing boring infrastructure work over shiny model releases.

Read on WebProNews ‚Üí

üí° My Take

Read this one: The "Claude AI Killed My Business" piece. It's provocative ‚Äî maybe overblown ‚Äî but the underlying concern is real. When AI platforms start doing what specialized SaaS used to do, the PMM software landscape reshuffles fast. Watch for consolidation in the GTM stack.
